I love the bow! Very 50's!!!
Great colors. Like it a lot.

title: Not exactly holy grail...
text: The concept behind this set of masks is pretty cool, and the names are cute.  The masks themselves, however, aren't anything to write home about.  They smell fresh in a more herbal kind of way, and the textures are a mix between creamy and gel-like.  The big issue I have is the container design.  The bowls come with a good sized amount because a little goes a long way, but there's no way to seal them back up for later use.  I had to put them in ziplock bags.

title: This stuff is awful!
text: I couldn't use this but one time!  It broke me out, dried me out, irritated my skin, and the rose scent is overwhelming.  The texture is fairly decent as far as cleansing balms go, but it's a very aggressive cleanser and not in a good way.  My skin felt rough and raw when I was done using it.  I've used Clean It Zero for a while and highly recommend it over this balm.  Steer clear!

title: Great size, nice and bright!
text: This is a really nice lighted, mirrored compact!  So many times, the lights aren't bright enough to do you much good, there's only a single regular mirror, and/or the size is just too small to give you a proper look.  Not so with this compact.  You get two mirrors for the price of one, a regular mirror and one with a higher magnification for those times when you need a closer inspection.  The light has a lovely, and very helpful, color temperature that's pretty close to daylight, just a bit warmer, and is featured around both mirrors.  It's operated by a switch on the bottom, so you aren't wasting your batteries.  It runs off of two coin batteries.  The mirror is larger than most.  I have larger than average hands for a woman, and this compact is bigger than my palm.  It's a great size for quick once overs and more detailed makeup application.  I even prefer using it over my bathroom mirror for doing my eyebrows.

title: Smells great and keeps my hands soft...
text: After falling in love with the C.O. Bigelow Rose Salve, I knew I had to give this a try.  I haven't been disappointed with the results.  Not only does it have a sweet, citrusy smell, it also moisturizes and softens my dry, chapped skin.  I deal with dry hands in the winter and I'm a big hand washer, so I end up with rough, cracked skin.  This light yellow, creamy hand lotion has helped to keep my hands from feeling like sandpaper without leaving them greasy.

title: Cute but the cap is too small...
text: I thought this would be a fun wig to wear to bed, if you get my drift.  It's cute and the colors are blended together nicely, with small streak of lavender mixed into the blue.  The "scalp" looks great and is a nice nude color.  It mimics a Caucasian scalp really well, which is great for a pale gal like me.  The cut is sweet and it's styled well.  The bangs need trimming up but that shouldn't be a problem.  The tresses feel like all synthetic wigs do.  They are wavy but still have that plastic feel to them.  The big issue for me is the size of the wig cap itself.  I have black hair and the wig "scalp" is so short that several inches of the top of my natural hair shows through it.  It does come with a hair cap but oddly, it's black and not nude, which would be the smarter choice.  I have a nude hair cap that I'll be trying with it, but I'm not expecting much difference.  The wig is just too small in general.

title: This little bugger works!
text: I'll be honest.  I was rather skeptical when I received this.  It looks sleek and pretty but does it actually work?  My answer to that question is a resounding YES.  You wouldn't think a little buzzing device could make your skincare products do their best job but boy, oh, boy does it ever.  The three settings are for Cleansing (also used for extractions), Moisturizing, and Lifting.  Each setting causes the device to vibrate at different speeds and achieve different goals.  Using it is fairly easy.  Hold the button until you hear it turn on and then give the button a quick press to choose between functions.  There are lights above each mode and they will light up when you are on said mode.  The included instructions are very easy to follow and explain how to use it in a simple way.  It's all about keeping very light pressure, while holding the side bars, which add the effective charge to the device, allowing the ionization process to take place.  I have seen a difference in my skin already and I have only used it in each mode 3-4 times.  It could be easy to overdo it after seeing the results you do, but the instructions specifically advice you on how often each function should be used so the skin isn't having reverse effects from what you want it to.  I think the price for this item is fantastic!  I have a reduction in blackheads, my skin seems to glow after use, and my products are sinking into my skin better and faster.  This one for the win!

title: Cool once you get the hang of it....but the price...
text: I'm someone with extremely thick and stick straight hair.  My hair loses curl within an hour of me fixing it.  I've tried other rotating curling irons and haven't had much success with them, so I didn't have very high expectations for this beach waver.  I have been pleasantly surprised.  Once I got the hang of it, I found it to be pretty easy to use.  It features buttons that allow you to chooses which direction you would like to curl each section of hair, and a Home button that after each use, and after the previous section of hair is no longer attached, allows the barrel to return to a neutral starting point.  I ran into an issue the first few times I used it, which was accidentally hitting the home button while my hair was still around the barrel.  This caused the hair to get very tight and the barrel to press up against the scalp.  This is very easy to do and I definitely think a design change should take place to correct this issue.  The barrel is long enough for my medium-long hair and I can see it needing to be used more than once up and down the length of long hair.  The curling iron gets up to 410 degrees max, which works pretty well on my thick hair.  I've tried fixing my hair in different ways after using it, to see which method holds the curls longer.  I still have an issue with my hair losing the curls a bit to quickly but it's remedied by using styling products before and after curling it.  To be honest, I think this beach waver is very overpriced.  Maybe the results would be better for someone with thinner hair but I don't think I'd pay more than $50 for this curling iron.  Nice results, but the design flaws make this a product I won't reach for that often.

title: I'm not sure this is worth the price asked...
text: I've always wanted to get into the art of doing my own acrylics so when I saw this drill set, I knew I had to review it.  Firstly, it comes with numerous accessories- a fluffy brush for removing dust from the nail and work area, a set of to separaters for painting, a nail board, and the drill bits themselves.  The entire set is nicely packaged and comes nestled in a velvety foam materials.  The bits are held in their own clear container within the box.  The set comes with a detachable adapter that plugs into the end of the drill and then into the wall outlet.  The drill itself is small enough to handle pretty easily, although I can see where it would be difficult for someone with smaller hands than myself (I have large hands.)  Inserting and removing the bits can be a challenge.  The mechanism isn't well made so I have to fight with it.  The power cord is much too short and I had to use an extension cord to give myself some wiggle room away from the wall outlet.  Some of the bits' textures do a better job than the others, while some don't do anything at all.  The over all look and feel of the set isn't worth the price, in my opinion.  It works a bit too awkwardly to be something I'd use that often.

title: Great lamp!
text: I really enjoy this UV lamp.  It's sleek design and concept make it easy to use.  I like the buttons designated for each separate drying time and the LED display is easy to read and understand.  It works like a champ and does a great job!  I truly think this lamp is worth the price, and I think you'll like it as much as I do.

title: You can't beat this price!
text: These are great cotton rounds!  I used to get the CVS 360 brand but they were getting expensive because I used a few each day.  Luckily, I found this huge pack of awesome rounds.  They are super soft but not so soft that they don't hold up when wet.  They are fantastic when you don't want to waste product because they absorb just the right amount and actually extend the life of my products.  The price is low and the amount of cotton rounds in this big pack can't be beat!

title: Meh product...
text: These are good for those late nights when you're too exhausted to do your whole routine, although I HIGHLY recommend doing a quick double cleansing regardless.  They seem to remove dirt but don't work well for removing oil-based makeup.  Make sure to understand that this has to be rinsed off, or you're falling asleep with soap on your face.  I won't be repurchasing.

title: Worth a try!
text: This kit is a great deal!  I've been a devoted user of Korean skin care products.  For a while, I have preferred, out of several brands and types of sheet mask, the Benton Bee and Snail sheet mask.  Fantastic product!!!!  Firms, smooths, soothes.  It's great.  However, that's not why I purchased this set.  I have combo skin that leans towards oily in the heat.  Super oily T-zone.  After doing a ton of research, I decided to give the Benton Aloe Gel moisturizer a try.  I'd also heard great things about this foam cleanser.  I'm really enjoying the cleanser so far.  I wet my hands and face, use only a pea sized amount, rub my hands together to create the foam (not a soapy lather, but a thick and creamy foam), and work over my face.  I do this after oil cleansing.  This does a great job of picking up any oil residue and dirt, while leaving my face soft and refreshed.  Never tight and dry, which is the sign of an awful cleanser.  The gel moisturizer is okay.  Just okay.  I don't get as oily as I did with lotion moisturizers, which is great.  However, I don't have that supple, smooth feel that I'm used to and prefer.  I've actually noticed flaking around my nose, which is something I never dealt with after moisturizing.  A pea sized amount covers my entire face, it leaves a slightly tacky finish until absorbed ( I always let each of my products absorb for around 90 seconds before applying the next step), and is completely colorless.  Will I repurchase?  No, but I do suggest that you give this a try if your research and needs point you this direction.  Everyone's skin care needs can vary on several levels.  There are universal musts for good skin health, like cleansing daily, moisturizing, and using a good sunscreen.  There a a ton a variations of those products, though.  Finding the right routine and products can be a trial and error process.  The main thing is to stick to it.  The results are worth it!

title: Exactly as promised!  Love it!
text: This is a very nice magnifying mirror, in a beautiful oil rubbed bronze finish!  Especially for the price point!  There were very similar items for twice as much, but I'm so glad I chose to purchase this one for our bathroom.  My husband is starting to get more gray in his beard than not, and has been having trouble seeing it all while shaving.  I got this for him (and for myself, but don't tell him) and he has been thrilled with it.  The three lighting choices are gorgeous and very useful, as is the 10x magnification side of the swivel mirror head.  I'm thinking of getting one for my mom and sister, as well.  Great buy!

title: Very clean wig and beautiful coloring!
text: This wig goes greatly with the Ahri outfit! The wig is super comfortable and smooth on your head. I absolutely love the tail ends of the hair because of the yellow and pink combination color!! The wig goes down a little past my chest area. It may feel a a bit heavy, but is not too bad to wear for long periods of time for an event.

title: Wonderful color that highlights the eye!
text: This product goes well with lightening up your eye. I found it is helpful to make my Asian eyes a bit bigger! I love the cute pink color and it makes your makeup much more attractive and more attention! Less is more is a helpful tip as the product can go on a bit much.

title: For 6 to 10 year old kids
text: The clips are larger then I expected. The colors are nice. The quality seems to be good. Overall it is a nice set.

title: Nice gift. Perfect for travel.
text: Ready to use straight out of the box. The color is pretty retro but it works. You will notice that it doesn't come with an outlet connection just a USB cable. You get a total of 6 brush head so you don't need to worry about replacements for a while. The brush heads aren't my favorite but they aren't bad. There is a control for the strength of the vibration which I love! It also gives notification after every 30 seconds, which is really great. Over all I am really happy.

title: Wonderful essential oil diffuser!
text: It does everything it says it will. I like the simple style it has, and it is very easy to use.

title: Good Value
text:
If you want an inexpensive skin treatment for your skin to moisturize and keep it fresh and young-looking, this product has some good ingredients. It says safe for dry and sensitive skin. I have combination skin, and it works fine for me.

Ingredients include: 100% Vegan Hyaluronic Acid - professional hydrating serum,enriched with anti-aging Vitamins C+E and Green tea. Also included is Jojoba Oil, Retinol and Aloe.

It fills in fine lines and plumps your skin, reduces age spots, brightens skin etc.

It is paraben-free, cruelty-free, hypoallergenic, vegan, and is a serum.

The price at $5 an ounce seems to be about 1/3 of other similar serums.

I use a rotation of products on my skin as each product has strengths and does what others don't. This seems to exfoliate a bit, and moisturize. My skin looked good the morning after I used it. You can put it on under foundation the company says.

It has about a 3-year shelf life. You will probably use it up in the first month or two.

title: Firms Up the Under Eye Area
text:
This goes on easily - has a metal rounded surface which emits watery liquid slowly.

It does firm up the skin around the eye as it dries.

I guess it would be great to put on before a party if your eyes are puffy. And at night to reduce puffiness in the morning.

Right now I like this product. After using it for a longer time, I might love this product.

It didn't hurt my eyes, sting, or get into my eyes as some eye products have done in the past. The ingredients appear healthy.

The product kind of rolls on like roll-on deoderant used to do. So, it's not messy.

title: Tastes Good
text:
This is NOT to put on your skin.

This is to drink.

My husband and I tasted it and liked the flavor. It is a yummy orange. The expiration date is January, 2019. So, you don't have to drink it right away. You DO need to refrigerate it. And use it within a month of opening it. You take one tablespoon a day, and follow with 8 oz. water.

This is fairly expensive. At $79 - about $2.50 which is an inexpensive meal.

title: So Far So Good
text: Like the container and the pump action.  Product feels pleasant with a light scent. Not wild about the scent, but if this works, it's okay.  It goes on easily.  So far, I like the product.  After using it a month, will decide if I love it as for what it does for my skin.  Like the natural ingredients in the product.

title: Take some getting used to
text:
Eyebrow Stamp Stencil Kit, Double EyeBrow
Stamp Kit, Perfect Eyebrow Powder Stamp
Makeup with with 24 Reusable Eyebrow
Stencil,2 Eyebrow Brushes and 1 Eyebrow
Trimmer (Dark Brown + Medium Brown)

My wife got this eyebrow stamp stencil kit for faster application. These arrived quickly, not that
well packaged but did not have any damage. She said that using the stencils does take some
getting used to, and the medium brown is a bit on the reddish side. However, the stencils
themselves are great. Since using these, her morning makeup routine has been faster than
before, now that she's gotten the hang of using these. Four stars.

title: diminishing breakouts
text:
Not Or Omega 7 Sea Buckthorn Oil Soft Gels,
Anytime Face Wash, Facial Defense Oil, Skin
Cleansing, Skin Moisturizing Core Kit

This facial cleansing wash, with sea buckthorn oil soft gels, and the facial defense oil, seem to
work really well together. My wife and daughter both get small bouts of acne during the month
and they've both benefited from this kit in diminishing breakouts and gently keeping their skin
clean and moisturized. They both want to continue using it and see if the soft gels make a
difference, but until then they are very happy with this kit. Four stars

title: Good during the winter months when skin is dryer
text:
[The Skin House] Wrinkle Snail System
Cream (1.69 fl.oz / 50ml) Firming, blemish,
repair, anti-aging

It took my wife a while to try this cream since it was made with snail mucin and to her, that
sounded less than appealing. However, once she did try it, she liked it. She said that it left her
skin softer and well hydrated. It doesn't have a bad smell, which she was concerned about, and
the consistency was smooth and not sticky. She has combination skin, so this cream will be
good during the winter months when her skin is dryer. However, she said she will use a lighter
cream for the warmer months. Four stars

title: Wife really loves it
text:
Facial Steamer Nano Hot Steam Face Spa
Device Ionic Face Steaming Machine for
Home Facials Personal Moisturizing
Humidifier Vaporizer for Skincare Beauty

My wife has always wanted a facial steamer but didn't want to spend too much money. So,
when I saw this one, I thought it was a good deal. So far, she really likes it. She says that the
water heats up quickly and the steam coming out is smooth and doesn't spit out any water. The
little cool mist steamer will come in handy on hot days, which will be coming up soon here in
California. Even though this comes with some acne removing tools, my wife has not used those
so cannot comment on whether they are effective or not. The steamer and mister, however, has
been something she really loves. Five stars

title: says water proof but has an open usb port
text:
Facial Cleansing Brush, Sonic Ultrasonic
Vibration Facial Brush, Red-light for Deep
Cleaning, Discharge Makeup, Gentle
Exfoliating, Blackhead Removing, Massaging
with 3 Adjustable Modes and Speeds

My wife has used many facial cleansing tools in the past, but wanted something with a little
more portability. After reading more about this brush, she liked the features it mentioned and
decided to try it. It arrived well packaged, and undamaged. It came with instructions and a usb
cord. After trying it for a while, my wife said she really likes the shape and the way it feels in her
hand. It is easy to maneuver around the contours of her face and she feels her face is getting
cleaner after using it. Although she likes the red light feature, it is not something she uses
regularly. She does like that it is small enough to carry in her purse. However, one of the main
reasons she wanted this is because of the waterproof capability. But with the usb port open, she
really does not feel comfortable using it in the shower. That was a disappointment. Also, it
does not come with a carrying case or bag, which would have been nice. I am giving it four
stars because the features we are left with are good ones and my wife feels that her skin has
improved since using this brush.

title: Not effective enough as some other skincare products
text:
MD Complete Bright & Healthy Citrus-C Refresh Retinol + Vitamin C Multitasking Treatment

My wife got this multitasking treatment of vitamin C and retinol, to combat uneven skin texture and fine lines. She used it for a while and afterward said that at least for her skin, she didn't notice that much of a difference. There was some brightening, but not effective enough as some other skincare products that she's tried. Overall, it may be good with those with minor skin issues, or maintaining good skin, but not if there's a skin issue that is trying to be reversed.

title: Plumps and smooths skin

Hylunia Facial Day Lotion - 1.7 fl oz - Anti-Aging for Wrinkles - with Shea Butter, Hyaluronic Acid Serum, Zinc - Natural Vegan Moisturizer - Rapid Skin Repair

My wife has recently started using Hylunia skin care products. So when she saw their Day Lotion, she thought she would give it a try. She is very happy with the results of this product. She said it plumps and smooths her skin and absorbs really well. It goes on well under her makeup and does not cause her foundation to streak. Even though it is a little pricey at around $67.00, it is definitely a product worth paying for.

title: contains clean ingredients

NATURAL Moisturizing Facial Masks (ALOE VERA 4PK Box) | Deep Moisturizer Face Sheet Masks for Dry, Sensitive and Tired Skin

My wife really liked this moisturizing face mask with aloe. She suffers from allergies, so her skin is dry and sensitive during those times. This face mask contains clean ingredients, and is perfect to get someone with allergies and sensitive through harsher weather months.

title: Awesome

text: Very handy and work great.  Took these on vacation recently and it was great to not need to take the bottle and worry about leakage.  Usually one pad will do all your nails but sometimes it takes a couple.  Recommended

title: A real time saver
text: I have shorter hair and this worked really well for me,  I honestly wasn't expecting that it was going to work in my shorter hair as the Barrel seems large but to the contrary it does a fabulous job.  Recommended

title: No SPF but keeps makeup in place great
text: Good primer.  It sprays on and feels a little sticky for about thirty seconds but then dries and feels smooth on your face.  Makeup goes on great and stays on really well.  Wish it had an SPF.  Recommended.

title: Lots of accessories
text: Nice nail kit, very thorough on the selection of accessories.  Works great.

title: Keeps puppy and dog fly-away hairs firmly in their bands
text:
This stuff is amazing! I didn't even know such a product existed and was excited to try it when I found it. My baby shih tzu has a top knot that's in the awkward stage where most will stay in a band or clip but the lower pieces fall down into her eyes.

I applied a bit of this and all the hair is staying put, LOVE THIS SO MICH! This tub will probably last me awhile but when it's gone I will be back to buy more.

title: Best clips for long, fine hair!
text:
My hair is long and very fine/slippery, so I generally find that jaw clips are too small to hold all of my hair, too large/weak to keep my hair from slipping loose, and/or too heavy and fall off off my head under its own weight. These clips address all issues fabulously: the long but narrow shape captures all of my hair but clamps it closely enough that the strands don't slip free and the lightweight nature means that gravity won't pull the clip loose. I can use these clips for both a full bun (I do need to double my long hair over to fit in the clip) or a half-up style.

I do object to calling the shade of these ‚Äúwine red‚Äù when the product picture is plainly some kind of magenta shade. The actual clips are darker and mauvier than pictured and certainly pretty, but a far cry from ‚Äúwine red‚Äù still.

title: Great dispenser, but overpriced product
text:
I don't find the dry shampoo powder itself to be much better than plain cornstarch or arrowroot flour, especially as a product for blondes. But, the squeeze top dispenser is excellent. I would not repurchase this, but plan to reuse the container for DIY powder dry shampoo.

Speaking as someone with black hair who did not realize this product was for blondes when ordering, this product had more of a white cast than most dry shampoos but it wasn't a huge issue---it largely blended away once worked in thoroughly as per usual. Last I checked, the version for brunettes was more expensive, which seems ridiculous.

title: Beautiful finish and wear time
text:
This is a beautiful foundation. I tried applying this both with a flocked powder puff and a foundation brush. I did prefer the powder puff, which did a better job of picking up the powder through the elasticated net dispenser. The finish is what I would call a "luminous matte" or "lit from within"---it definitely wasn't flat but didn't look dewy or greasy, either. It applied very smoothly over some very textured spots on my skin and covered blemishes well.

Unfortunately, the shade range sucks. I typically need a shade described as "very fair", which are harder to find in mineral foundations. The 100 Light shade is too dark for me unless I also cover my whole neck and chest with it, but the finish is beautiful and I honestly would wear it out on days I'm wear a scarf, for example. I would describe this shade as fair-light or light with a neutral peach undertone.

If you are familiar with the Tarte loose powder foundation, this seems very similar but without the clay that tends to oxidize. They have the same style of packaging (elasticated net + stopper lid), same luminous matte finish, and similar longevity.

title: Excellent for travel and regular use
text:
These are very sturdy bottles with a smooth pump mechanism. I saw no leaking when I used these to fly with shampoo and conditioner recently.

Each pump is fairly small and consistent, which makes it very easy to regulate the amount used. I think I will be using these regularly and not just for travel for items without a pump or where the pumps are very inconsistent, like body lotion.

title: Lovely talc-free blushes
text: Such as beautiful shade! I really like that the Cheek Pop formula can be applied very sheerly, which means that I, as a very pale person, can wear deeper blush shades like Cola Pop. I still need to be very careful to use a light hand with application, though. Also, the Cheek Pop formula is talc-free!

title: Makeup pads!
text: Great deal for the price. Not that easy to clean. But for the price I will order more and toss these out.

title: Irritates my skin...
text: These aren't pads to clean make-up off your face(at least not fully), like I thought they were. They're actually supposed to be used after washing your face. After wiping your face with them, you're supposed to press any excess liquid onto your skin and then leave it. I found them a little too harsh for my skin. On the front of the container, it says they're soothing, but I didn't get that at all. My face feels scratched and irritated after I use them and I for sure don't like the feeling of leaving the liquid on my face. It's an itchy feeling and it makes me anxious, as opposed to soothed. I ended up having to wash it off after each time I gave them a try. I like the idea of them, but unfortunately, they're not for me.

title: Quieter than regular clippers, but best for thinner hair....
text:
My children don't like haircuts, but my 6 year old has an especially hard time with it. While these seem mostly targeted to babies, I decided to give them a try for my older children. These clippers helped the process and all of my children preferred them. That said, these do work better on thinner hair. My two older children have thick hair and these clippers struggled with it. I ended up using another pair of clippers to thin their hair out a bit before swapping back to these. I didn't mention trying new clippers or explain the swapping back and forth, but they still requested I go back to these. These clippers do still make noise when in use, but it is more muted than regular clippers.

Overall, I'd say these are great to use on thinner/finer hair, but for thicker hair, just be prepared to thin it out first. Other than that, I've been super pleased with them.

title: Hard to wash out....
text: This cream works pretty well and it doesn't take much. It kept my hair from being frizzy and it defined my curls. That said, maybe my hair is too fine for it. It left an odd feeling to my hair(like a layer of residue) and it's super hard to wash out. I like to wash all products out of my hair before going to bed and I didn't like that my hair still felt dirty after washing(even using my best shampoo). Overall, it's not for me. It may be better for thicker hair, though.

title: Does its job...
text: The case of this kit looks on the cheap side. It's almost like stained silver. That said, the tools inside work well. They're not my favorite, by any means, but they do the job. It is a nice travel sized kit, so it would work well for small spaces, too. There are quite a few items inside, so it's a little annoying trying to get certain items out. I didn't know what a good bit of them were for, but it still has a place for everything, all within a small-ish, flat case. It has everything I need for my nails(plus more) and doesn't take up much space, so I have to appreciate it for that.

title: Smells Nice
text:
My husband is using this deodorant, and he likes it.

He hasn't tested out the 48 hour claim, but I haven't noticed him smelling sweaty at any point. ;)

The scent is overwhelming. It's smells a bit like a nice, manly soap.

Overall, no complaints.

title: Love this mascara
text: Love this mascara! High volume, lots of coverage, very dramatic lashes. I really love that this package comes with a small waterproof mascara as well, I don't want to use waterproof daily and I don't want to buy a large one but I love it for beach days in the summer!

title: Portable, handy, easy to clean!
text: These little combs are amazing! Great at combing clumps out of my lashes after I apply mascara. Portable, and easy to clean!

title: Cute
text: My 7 year old loves this as she is still at the age where she can get away with it. Older kids tend to worry more about each other. This box has 74 accessories for your little girls hair all in a divided reusable container. All decently made items just don't leave them with smaller children alone as it would be a hazard.

title: Lot of bang for your buck
text:
The quality of the sound is more than the price paid. These headphones will give ones that I paid 10 times the price a run for their money. The cord is plenty long for gaming I just used them on ps4 along with virtual gear and the experience was awesome. I love the way they fit and can't hear much else if anything when wearing this product. One thing I love is the mute Microphone option on them it comes in handy. You won't go regret this purchase and the can't beat the price.

Note
My reviews are honest no matter the product nor the price I paid . If my review helped you in your purchase take a moment and click helpful.

title: Glad Honest for Men finally got it sorted out and offers two varieties - one exfoliating and one not
text:
Gotta take a moment to write a review because this is my favorite soap. The other kind they make (the non-exfoliating kind) went through phases - first it was exfoliating, then they got bad reviews because it was TOO exfoliating (which I absolutely loved about it), then they removed ALL of the exfoliation and got bad reviews because there wasn't any exfoliation any more... and finally they got it together to have two varieties, one without any exfoliation, and one with exfoliation - this one. And the other one is now stuck with a 3 star review average just because of that mix-up.

At first I was nervous that even with the exfoliation back (this one), it would not be as good as it was before when it had the exfoliation originally, because it used to be oatmeal for the exfoliation, and now it is coffee grounds. I even sent them a note asking why they didn't use oatmeal any more, and they said it was because the oatmeal version would fall apart in the Amazon warehouses. But I tried the coffee ground exfoliation - and even though it isn't quite as good - it's still great. This soap beats any other I've tried to purchase, and I have purchased about 10 brands through Amazon that all said they were exfoliating. Only one of them was exfoliating enough, and I like this one better. (I forget the name of that other brand right now; I'm at my computer. If someone really wants to know, add a comment and I'll dig it up.) I really need a very strong exfoliating soap, and this one actually is strong enough. It also happens to be a brown bar with a decent hearty soap material, as well - not phony - so it is all I need.

Just wanted to post this review to start to bring back some 5 stars for this company now that they've gotten things sorted out and have two varieties, one exfoliating and one that isn't.

title: Exfoliating version is back!!!  Now they have two varieties - one with and one without exfoliation
text:
*** UPDATE Nov 9 2015 ***
They have now added the exfoliating version back, in another listing. That means people who love this soap for whatever other reasons without the exfoliation can give it 5 stars for that. People like me, who can't find strong exfoliating soap from any other brand (I have specifically ordered at least 10 other brands, Loofah, etc. etc. just trying to find one with strong exfoliation - and none have it, except maybe Tasmanian (http://amzn.com/B00CQOHOXY (but this is better)), can now use Honest For Men again - their exfoliating line. So not this listing, but the other listing. Not that exfoliating soap should matter, but actually, I'd be scrubbing with rocks from brooks if humans lived out in nature.

*** Original review a few days before ***

This was my favorite soap - and I depended on it for the fantastic exfoliation, better than any other I've tried (and I tried a dozen kinds).

All of a sudden, in this last batch, they have simply removed the exfoliation completely. Now, when you look at the website, it says "Important Information: We have recently removed our exfoliating oats and coffee grounds due to customer feedback. Our scent is now 100% essential oils no fragrance oil."

Well, I'm here to give you a 1 star review for this "important information". There are 1,000 other soaps that you can buy with various interesting scents, etc. But this was the only soap you can buy that had great exfoliation.

And now they've removed it.

Hopefully, the 'customer feedback' that caused them to remove the exfoliation will be blasted away by the customer feedback complaining that the exfoliation is missing, and they'll put it back.

In the meantime - goodbye, 'Honest for Men'.

title: Works Great for Bubble Making

title: Great hair diffuser
text:
I've been trying to get better about regularly going to a salon for a hair cut. For years I just went to Great Clips once a year. Basically, I'd go whenever I hated my hair so I'd have to chop inches off of split ends. But now I have a salon and a hair stylist I love so I'm trying to go every 3 or so months. My stylist recommended that I start using a hair diffuser whenever I dry my hair because I have naturally curly hair.

I don't use heat on my hair often but when I do, I've been attaching this to my hair dryer. I have the Infiniti Pro by Conair 1875 Watt Full Size Salon Performance AC Motor Styler/Hair Dryer (that I also bought from Amazon) and this fits on it perfectly. I read reviews that sometimes this hair diffuser doesn't work on all hair dryers because the diameter is smaller or larger than what this is compatible. But I measured the diameter of my hair dryer so I knew it would work. And I love how my hair reacts to being diffused. My curls just look marvelous. I almost wish I had time to blow dry my hair every day - almost.

I love how it's collapsible so it doesn't take up too much space under my sink. I definitely recommend this product if you're looking for a diffuser.

title: Five Stars
text: Good weight and the ridges in the bottom seem to help with lathering.

title: Beautiful and very comfortable brush.
text: Good for reducing static which is a nuisance in the dry season.. Really easy on my hair.  Bought it for my wife, who kept stealing my brush- now I find myself stealing hers.. Looks nice too.

title: It's smarter than me.
text: This is my first horsehair brush. Immediately, I liked it as the more compact size makes my soap last forever.. It's the perfect amount of lather for two to three passes. And the brush itself lathers extraordinarily well in a bowl, though it is softer than boar on the face- best badger or softer! BUT.. I recommend getting some tutelage on a forum or youtube about care of horsehair brushes- Being a bit of a masher (my old boar brushes are pretty splayed), I wound up with a bit of a birdsnest in the center of the brush which i had to detangle. I was immediately disappointed and shelved it- I was going to try and sell it. But the few great shaves I had made me want to try to use it right and now, with less pressure (ease up if it feels scratchy at all) and slightly different motions (figure 8s instead of circles, incidentally) I get great lather (using tabac) and the brush doesn't tangle- and it's even smoother and softer on the face. I'm so glad I took a little care to figure this fantastic brush out.

title: The best.
text:
After having used this product for a month, I find myself hooked. As YMMV when taking someone's word on shave gear, I thought I might provide some background about me: I have gentle to oily skin and stiff, tough neck hairs. I used to think I had sensitive skin until I married someone with actual sensitive skin. But the combination of the tough hairs and the gentleness of my skin leads to irritation on the neck when I am not careful. I learned to shave with a gillette adjustable years ago(which I still use), but out of "convenience" (really, a lack of good shaving products and knowhow) I stopped using it for cartridge systems in my early twenties. Since I started shaving right, some time ago, I got an EJ-89 which I use when I'm feeling raw, and an old type open comb gillette (which, for the moment at least, I favor for its closeness- I use personna lab blue blades or sharper in it). I've tried a number of different soaps and a few creams, most of which are good. Mitchell's is excellent. It has a simple, clean smell like fresh linen and is the most thoroughly hydrating shaving product I have ever used. It lathers up easily- I've used my beat up old drugstore boar brush which is now probly 15 years old and a silvertip badger brush.. In either case, the lather whips up in a minute or less with no complications. I'm not one of these people that soaks the puck either, I just heat it up in its dish, in a basin of hot water as I soak my brush and it is good to go. I've heard that water hardness and temp can make a difference with this stuff, but as I have decidedly soft water here in the city, I can't really comment on that. But once you get the lather right, with enough water, it is eaaasy on the face. Amazing even.. I dreamt wetshaving was like this as a teenager..
One might be put off by the price which may seem hefty for a newcomer to the wetshaving game, eager to start saving money (previously lost on walking the cartridge treadmill) and reticent to buy apparently expensive luxury shaving soaps, but aside from being a quality product, It lasts for a quite a while. I was really going to wait until I had exhausted mine to write this review but it's been a month, and the puck looks basically the same size! Growing up on Williams soap and favoring Van der Hagen as a drugstore standby these days, I notice one soap generally lasts me a month (some less than that), but aside from the simply larger size of Mitchells (4.4 oz to 2.5 oz for standard mug size soaps), you just get more bang for your buck. I'm guessing this one will last me three months or more.. So at that rate, the price basically factors out altogether.
To sum up, if you have gentle or easily irritated skin and aren't looking for a heavily scented product, this is the grail of soaps for you. One word: I wouldn't spring for the dish because I am cheap. You might not be.. But the soap itself does perfectly fit a rice bowl or large ramekin, in case you were wondering.. Probably not a mug though, unless it were seriously oversized..

title: The best I've ever used. Without question.
text: title says it all.

title: Best I've every used
text: I've tried many different types of shave soap. This is by far the best I've every used. There's a reason it get so many good reviews.

title: It works.... Just not how it claims too.
text:
After reading the reviews about nail bed damage and how well this helps the soak off I ended up getting it.

Firstly, it does peel a little nail bed up, so the damage thing is accurate. I wouldn't suggest using it "as advertised". However, after nudging off one nail I dis the standard coarse board, polish remover soaked cotton balls, wrap my fingers in foil thing. The soak off is MUCH easier with this as the base coat. They come off faster, more cleanly and leave behind no damage.

I'm only giving it three stars for a few reasons. It doesn't do what it says it should do. It does lift. On my second try, after the first experiment, I did my nails again. Several nails lifted and peeled. Some came completely free with no damage. Usually my gels outlast my level of interest, and I soak them off before I even go the full two weeks. These definitely have a gripping problem. That's not a negative for me. It makes polish changes easier. However, it mean that they don't do what they're supposed to do.

Bottom line, the things about this product that make it convenient for me are counter to what the product is advertised as doing. I imagine that would make it a poor buy for many a gel lover.

title: Excellent quality
text: These are my favorite facial wash clothes. The only ones I use. Absorbent but soft. Good looking, too.

title: Excellent disposable wax treatment
text:
This is an excellent portable paraffin wax treatment. I really love how it makes my hands feel really silky and smooth. I can't really do anything when these are on my hands, but they feel nice and I like relaxing with them. Also, the black heart on the outside actually turns red when the wax gets really hot. I used mine in the microwave, and it worked really well.

They have a unique design, which is basically a plastic hand wrapper that has a spongy interior, and the sponge holds all of the paraffin wax so that it delivers it right to your hands. It also stays hot for a pretty long time, which surprised me that all the heat didn't dissipate really quickly.

These are made for average hands, so if your hands are giant, then these might be hard to fit into. But, they should work pretty well for most hands. Also, they're great for the first treatment, but for subsequent treatments, it's really tough to keep the wax in the sleeve while microwaving.

But, overall, they're awesome for disposable paraffin treatments.

Pros:
+Makes your hands feel silky smooth
+The spongy interior absorbs and holds most of the wax
+The heat indicator really works

Cons:
-May not last a full five treatments

*TGN gave me this wax to review*

title: My son loves this!
text: My son loves this tooth brush!! I asked my hygienist what she thought of this kind of brush and she said go for it! Whatever makes kids brush their teeth! Lol. I read online that this kind isn't good for adults because it doesn't reach the top of their teeth, but it does reach for kids.

title: Give these pads a try with your Shu Uemura Eyelash Curler. They do the job!
text:

The bleached blond streaks are very bleached -- too much so for my hair color (dark blond), so I plan to darken these streaks with a darker hair color.  We'll see how that works :-)  I wish I'd gotten the more solid, dark blond or light brown.  I purchased the 18" extensions based on other reviews that said they are very thin at the bottom -- I wanted more thickness to my hair, not more length (although I would have been open to additional length if that worked out) and I wanted enough length that I could trim them, if needed.  I'm glad I did this -- I was able to cut off about 2" of very wispy ends to match my own hair length.  When I clipped them in before cutting them to length, the wispy ends looked obvious and weird where they extended beyond my own hair length because there just wasn't enough hair at the ends to look right.  In any case, when I cut them to match my own hair length, they did exactly what I wanted -- I ended up with a nice thick braid.  These extensions are totally straight -- to achieve the look of the woman in the photo with wavy hair, you'd need to use a curling iron or curlers to add that wave.

title: Works much better than acetone, but watch your surfaces!
text:
Do you see ‚Äú100% Natural‚Äù and think ‚ÄúYeah, right!‚Äù or do you assume it won't work as well as products that have chemicals? I do this all the time especially when it comes to cleaning products or makeup. In this case I was offered a bottle of Pure Body Naturals‚Ñ¢ 100% Natural Nail Polish Remover and the skeptical part of me was sure this wouldn't turn out well. But in the spirit of trying new things, I agreed to review it and put it to the test. **See the images for before/after photos**

For my test I painted my nails several different colors. We all know deep reds are harder to get off and glitters can also be a pain to remove. I dedicated my left hand to the Pure Body Naturals‚Ñ¢ 100% Natural Nail Polish Remover and my right hand I used a drugstore brand of acetone polish remover (the super cheap stuff I usually use.) Both hands got two good coats of polish.

To remove the polish the Pure Body Naturals‚Ñ¢ remover instructions say to drop or dab it on and wait 2-3 minutes before wiping. For the generic acetone remover I just apply and wipe with a cotton ball.

The Pure Body Naturals‚Ñ¢ remover wiped right off, taking most of the polish with it. I did have to reapply a small amount, wait a few more minutes and all but one tiny trace of the red polish was gone. The acetone remover left polish near my cuticles even after a hard scrubbing and a second try.

So what did I like?
-I like that it works better than the acetone remover, even on the darkest red and glitter!
-I like that it did not make my nails feel dry.
-I like that the Pure Body Naturals‚Ñ¢ remover doesn't have harsh chemicals.
-I like that it isn't tested on animals.
-I like that it comes with a handy glass dropper.

The only problem (and it could have been a BIG one) is this polish will eat through any polish, including vanish on my dining room table and styrofoam plates. No kidding. I started out thinking to drip the remover over a plate to keep it off the table but it quickly melted the styrofoam and one small spot of the table varnish.

Only use this stuff in the bathroom over tile or a sink with no finish/paint/lacquer, etc. never over a delicate surface like your dining room table!

I received a free sample of this remover to review. I have given my honest opinion and the real test/comparison results.

title: New Maybuy Beard Trimmer Takes On Viking Beard -- And Wins!
text:
The gene pool I come from has Viking, German, and Irish heritage -- resulting in a stiff wiry beard that defeats most cordless beard trimmers. To give this trimmer a good chance I followed the directions and charged it for the two hours as recommended in the instructions. My only gripe about this process is that you're supposed to keep an eye on it so that when charging is finished you can disconnect it immediately to avoid potential damage. Since the unit has no automatic shut-off when charging is completed, you have to keep an eye on it to avoid a problem. That is my only gripe about this unit. Not too many people have the time flexibility to watch it for the two hours (or less) it needs to charge.

While it only comes with 3 attachments that is all you really need. The shaver itself is large enough to give you a firm grip and the weight implies quality. The initial effort at trimming my beard was highly successful. I grew it for two weeks to make it a challenge and then shaved it without using any attachments. Normally (with other units) I would have expected difficulty in shaving it flush with my skin. Typically this type of trimmer is not powerful enough to plow through my beard, pulls some hair out instead of cutting it, and sometimes nicks my skin. None of that happened here. Evidently the battery and the motor are up to the task.

This is by far the best cordless trimmer I have ever owned and used. Highly recommended!

I'm not well versed in extensions and the like, but thought this was a great idea to change things up every once in a while. The hair itself is beautiful. No shedding issues, no unusual tangling and no weird smells. I was able to straighten if I wanted to and once washed, it went back to it's beautiful natural texture.
My only issue with this is the net is huge and I had issues with how to apply it without it bulking up. As I said, I'm not the best with these things but it seems that this piece could be a bit smaller. My 2nd issue is that the strip of hair to wrap around to secure is very thin. I've seen others that are thicker w/ more hair, which makes it easy to hide where the fake hair is secured to your actual ponytail. My 3rd issue is the velcro kept getting caught on my real hair. You have to be super careful but since it was a bit difficult to secure because of the huge net, sometimes I was going so slow that the hair would shift and I had to start again. Kind of hard to explain but I think if I could apply this without worrying about pulling my hair out, it would be easier to secure. Anyway, once I got it on it looked great and I'm sure I'll use it here or there. Just some things for potential buyers to be aware of.

title: Finally Found....

She purchased another brand-the "container" drives me bananas, makes a HUGE mess-so I asked her "why didn't she purchase Cashmere powder anymore?" She explained she couldn't find it anywhere-so this product became a "stocking stuffer" surprise along with the Amazon.com/DealsBuzz info. so Mom can still smell like Mom!

title: Lashes are a great length, but.......
text:
I ordered this set for the lashes since I already have some liner. I am very glad I do have the liner because the one that comes with this set is crap. I made sure my eyes were clean and dry. I read the directions on the back of the package...
shake the liner 10 times (I made sure I shook it more than that), apply a thick layer and let dry a few seconds (it took longer than that) apply another thick coat then get the lash and apply it to the liner area. gently press down.
Very simple right? NOPE. The edges kept lifting up and the lash fell off after a couple of blinks. OK I thought, maybe my liner wasn't thick enough, so I applied another really good coat and then tried the lash again....Same results. I then washed my eye again and tried with my other liner and the lash stayed on like it should.
I like the lashes very much. All three pair are a natural length (IF you use mascara), and vary in looks. If you get these, make sure you have another liner available or plan to purchase one.

The light is really light, if you're very light skinned it's the perfect color or if you're doing contouring it's perfect.

title: Pumps don't work, but product seems to help avoid bumps
text: This stuff works, but if you don't reapply it while not in the shower, you will get bumps a few days later. I know it's made to be rinsed off, but that is the only way I have found to keep it from getting bumpy. I would suggest just buying something to put on after you shave to keep the bumps and ingrowns away. My main complaint is that the pumps don't even work! Super annoying.

title: Pretty but not effective
text:
While the stickers themselves are adorable they are actually pretty slick and don't keep me or my child from sliding around. The bottom of my tub came with a better non-slip tread than these stickers have.

I would recommend these more for decorating the side of the tub rather than using them as a non-slip pad.

title: Perfect for allergic people / too expensive at 7$ for 25
text: These are my family's wipes of choice. No perfume, gentle, and very moist. They have been wonderful for our extended camping trips. They have also been on my subscribe & save, but at about 5$, they were a bit expensive. Recently, the price is over 7$ for 25 in a pack. We have switched to a different brand , 90 in pack, with cucumber scent. A better bargain, but allergic reaction within the family is still unknown.
